Detailed Description

Provides cross-platform support for persistent application settings.

Deprecated:

Use DzAppSettings now instead of this class.

The Application Settings Manager is a class that is used to store and retrieve settings that persist from one execution of the Appliction to the next. On Windows, the settings are saved in the registry. On Mac, these settings are saved via Mac preference plist files.

There is only one instance of this manager in an application. This instance is created and owned by DzApp. Don't create an instance of this class, but rather request a pointer to it from DzApp via DzApp::getAppSettingsMgr().

Example: 

    void saveSetting()
    {
        // This function uses the application settings manager to save a string setting
        QString             setting( "A string to be saved" );
        DzAppSettingsMgr    *settingsMgr = dzApp->getAppSettingsMgr();

        // add a temporary 'subdirectory' onto the settings manager path
        settingsMgr->pushPath( "MyPlugin" );

        // store the setting
        settingsMgr->setStringValue( "MySetting", setting );

        // return the settings manager path to its previous state.
        settingsMgr->popPath();
    }

    void readSetting()
    {
        // This function uses the application settings manager to read the string setting
        // saved in the previous function.
        QString             setting;
        DzAppSettingsMgr    *settingsMgr = dzApp->getAppSettingsMgr();

        // add a temporary 'subdirectory' onto the settings manager path
        settingsMgr->pushPath( "MyPlugin" );

        // retrieve the setting
        setting = settingsMgr->getStringValue( "MySetting" );

        // return the settings manager path to its previous state.
        settingsMgr->popPath();
    }

def Default value - this value is returned if the key fails to be read.
ok If not NULL, this will be set to true if the setting was read, false if the key was not found or the value was the wrong type.
Returns:
The value of the requested key

void DzAppSettingsMgr::pushPath ( const QString &  path  )  [slot]
Deprecated:
Sets the current key path temporarily to the given path. This must be matched with a call to popPath().
Parameters:
path The subdirectory(s) to add to the current key path.
